other_tests.findings: Confirmed the presence of a large mesencephalic AVM (Spetzlerâ€“Martin Grade 4) supplied mainly by two posterior cerebral artery feeding branches.
Revealed the presence of a patent ductus venosus (PDV).
Showed an increase in portal pressure from 12 to 21 to 23 mm Hg.
Showed the disappearance of the AVM nidus.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Angiography studies conducted in January 2006 confirmed complete regression of the AVM.
